channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: To keep AI out of her classroom, this high school English teacher went analog
item.description: Forth Worth teacher Chanea Bond says sticking with pen and paper keeps generative artificial intelligence out of her American literature classes.

item.title: How bystander videos of law enforcement have shaped public understanding
item.description: Bystander videos have shaped public perception for decades. The ability to now spread video widely can lead to real-time access and transparency, but ...

item.title: CBP has a history of excessive force. Critics say they were unprepared for Minnesota
item.description: Experts say federal immigration agents' skills are a dangerous mismatch for urban settings such as the Twin Cities

item.title: As the U.S. bids adieu to the World Health Organization, California says hello
item.description: In the wake of the U.S. withdrawal from WHO, California is the first state to participate in the agency's disease monitoring network. Are others follo...

item.title: 3 generations of women in one family show how choices on motherhood have changed
item.description: In one family, three generations of American women explore how choices around becoming mothers have changed at the same time the U.S. birth rate has d...

item.title: Amazon slashing some 16,000 jobs in its latest layoff round
item.description: Amazon is cutting about 16,000 jobs after eliminating some 14,000 in October.

item.title: Rubio to testify about Venezuela at Senate hearing today
item.description: The hearing will be the first chance for lawmakers to publicly question the secretary of state about the capture of Nicolás Maduro and the future of t...

item.title: Former law enforcement trainer sees "unanswered questions" in Alex Pretti's shooting
item.description: A former federal law enforcement trainer says the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers raises serious concerns...

item.title: NASA plane makes belly landing at Texas airport, video shows
item.description: Video shows the NASA WB-57 plane touching down with a jolt, its wings bouncing as yellow fire and white smoke bursts from beneath it.

item.title: Three brothers die after falling in frozen Texas pond
item.description: Their mother says she tried to rescue them by lifting them out but the ice kept breaking.

item.title: Former Iraqi PM Maliki denounces Trump threats to end support if he returns to power
item.description: The US president said Iraq would have "zero" chance of success without American support.

item.title: 'I don't let bullies win': US congresswoman Omar defiant after substance thrown at her
item.description: The Minnesota Democrat was uninjured and continued to speak at her event, after being sprayed with an unidentified liquid.

item.title: Malaysia football officials quit over foreign-born players scandal
item.description: Fifa had accused Malaysia's football association of doctoring citizenship documents.

item.title: More ‘No Kings’ protests planned for March 28 as outrage spreads over Minneapolis deaths
Rwanda seeks £100m from UK over axed asylum deal
item.description: The African nation argues it is owed payments but the Home Office says it will fight the case.

item.title: Iranian man describes surviving deadly protest crackdown

item.title: 2 federal officers fired shots during encounter that killed Alex Pretti, DHS tells Congress

item.title: Man arrested after spraying unknown substance on Rep. Ilhan Omar at Minneapolis town hall
